div.p: robocat nausea is when you see the same
person and you introduce yourself to
them every time just like Groundhog Day
and that's just part of who I am it gets
a little better as i get to know people
better but not perfect and when i
started coming to hack night about three
and a half years ago there were a lot of
new faces not quite as many as there are
now because our room was smaller so i'm
just going to mention a few of them
because we do not always know how cool
each other is and how the people who are
right here with you can help you do cool
things and to meet some of the
challenges that people in times like
this are looking to Civic hackers and
civic folk to do so Eric who isn't here
tonight calls himself oftentimes a
janitor of data now if you have ever had
to clean a data set you know that that
is actually very high calling josh makes
math and you know we're living at a time
when it's really really easy to make a
map anyone can do it you you put
together a spreadsheet and you throw it
into Google Fusion Tables and you press
a button and it makes a nap or sometimes
it doesn't yeah Steve he also makes maps
but he's done a bunch of other things
and I'm not even going to start on some
of the stuff he helped me with Jill wall
she hardly ever comes but she's come two
or three times and the very second time
that i was here at hack night she wanted
to connect
sometimes they're just these
serendipitous connections that happen
she is no longer at health and
disability advocates but i am still
there and this is one of the kinds of
things that happen here um so if you
have jobs to offer or jobs to seek or
just networking connections you want to
make this is this is a good place there
have also been some familiar faces that
i encountered here some odd reunions car
logo i I know him because my husband was
friends with his dad so yeah you never
know what's going to happen Rob's peril
my neighbor my buddy he knows census
data the way that some people know
chocolate and he is thinking of giving a
free class in it so you know if it's
standing you guys know I'm call him and
tell him to do it Michaela blaze when I
um when she works for me she was 14
years old my I would have had to walk
her home in the evening if she stayed
late and her mom would give me a glass
of milk her mom was my exact same age to
this day I I call her mrs. Johnson one
day I was I was sitting there on on the
on that backstage and michaela now a mom
and a political organizer had brought a
bunch of students here to learn about
civic hacking because it was important
for politics sat down right next to me
you know we we stood up and we hugged
each other and everyone applauded um
honey / clinkle the stuff she said when
she was here last month in mental locks
and maybe
because it was about hands-on practical
democracy of a kind that the life force
needs to be there just what she looked
like when I worked with her yeah people
just come in here and and they say
amazing things here's just a few
examples of ones that have meant a lot
to me they're certainly not the only
ones um people have been shouting out
examples of amazing talks and the thing
about this place is that it's not that
unusual for people to come and say
amazing and inspiring things and
therefore whatever your problem is if
you can't recognize other people or
whatever your issue is that is that
doesn't mean that you shouldn't get to
know the people around you because in
the times we're in they can help you be
your coolest self and that's all
